meanings.definition: The act of directing or managing
meanings.sent1: Her conducting of the meeting was efficient and organized.
meanings.sent2: The conducting of the orchestra by the maestro was impressive.
meanings.sent3: The conducting of the school play turned into a comedy of errors.
meanings.sent4: His conducting of the project was like a captain steering a ship through rough waters.
meanings.sent5: The conducting of the investigation brought clarity to the situation.

meanings.definition: The act of transmitting or conveying
meanings.sent1: The conducting of electricity through the wire caused the light to turn on.
meanings.sent2: The conducting of information through the internet is crucial for communication.
meanings.sent3: The conducting of emotions through music can be a powerful experience.
meanings.sent4: The conducting of heat through the metal made it warm to the touch.
meanings.sent5: The conducting of sound through the air created a beautiful melody.

meanings.definition: The act of leading or guiding
meanings.sent1: His conducting of the hiking group ensured they stayed on the right path.
meanings.sent2: The conducting of the tour by the guide made the visit informative and enjoyable.
meanings.sent3: The conducting of the team to victory was a result of strong leadership.
meanings.sent4: The conducting of the horse by the rider showcased their bond and trust.
meanings.sent5: The conducting of the students through the museum provided a learning experience.
